decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to establish control and resource advantage through the utilization of UrzaTron lands and powerful Eldrazi creatures. By assembling the UrzaTron lands, the deck aims to ramp up mana quickly to cast big threats like Karn, the Great Creator, Thought-Knot Seer, and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. The inclusion of cards like Devourer of Destiny and Kozilek's Command helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and establish dominance on the battlefield.

The deck focuses on using artifact creatures and artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It utilizes cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Memnite to quickly deploy threats while also generating card advantage with cards like Thoughtcast and Mishra's Bauble. The key strategy is to use Urza's Saga to tutor for key artifacts like Cranial Plating and Shadowspear to enhance the power of its creatures. The inclusion of Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary provide additional reach and removal options to push through damage and control the board.

The main idea of this deck is to mill your opponent's library as quickly as possible using cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, and Archive Trap. By controlling your opponent's resources with cards like Fatal Push and Drown in the Loch, and disrupting their strategy with Tasha's Hideous Laughter and Surgical Extraction, you can grind them down until they have no cards left to draw. Utilizing cards like Preordain and Visions of Beyond to dig through your deck, this combo-focused UB Mill deck aims to win by emptying your opponent's library before they can win through traditional means.

The main focus of this Modern UrzaTron Control deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, Mine) to quickly ramp up mana and play powerful threats such as Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. The deck also utilizes Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths to disrupt opponents' strategies and control the game. With access to versatile spells like Kozilek's Command and All Is Dust, along with solid removal options, this deck aims to establish board control and close out the game with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on using Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker in combination with Blade of the Bloodchief to create a powerful combo that can quickly overwhelm opponents. It also includes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End for added control and threat. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Eldrazi Temple and Boseiju, Who Endures, while also utilizing support cards like Malevolent Rumble and Sowing Mycospawn for additional utility and protection. Ugin's Labyrinth and Urza's Saga provide additional support and consistency to the deck's strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Solitude in combination with instant speed interaction like Ephemerate and Force of Negation to protect the combo. Atraxa, Grand Unifier provides additional value and disruption, while cards like Psychic Frog and Faithful Mending help dig for combo pieces. The deck also includes a small control package with Teferi, Time Raveler and Thoughtseize, along with a variety of lands to support the color requirements. Superior Spider-Man offers a unique win condition, ensuring a versatile and resilient combo strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand or Atraxa using Goryo's Vengeance and Faithful Mending. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy with Thoughtseize, Force of Negation, and Prismatic Ending while setting up the combo. Ephemerate and Solitude provide additional protection and removal options. The deck also includes cards like Priest of Fell Rites and Psychic Frog to facilitate the reanimation process. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on playing powerful spells without the need for traditional lands. Utilizing cards like Disrupting Shoal and Hydroelectric Specimen, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent while ramping into powerful combo pieces like Goblin Charbelcher and Tameshi, Reality Architect. The deck also includes control elements like Sink into Stupor and Suppression Ray to handle threats. By utilizing card draw and tutor effects like Whir of Invention and Waterlogged Teachings, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with powerful spell combos.

This Aggro - Affinity deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly by utilizing artifacts and cheap creatures to deal damage efficiently. The deck includes cards like Cranial Plating and Shadowspear to pump up creatures, along with Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp up mana production. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga provide additional utility and card advantage. The deck's main strategy is to flood the board with artifacts and use synergies between cards like Thought Monitor and Thoughtcast to maintain card advantage while constantly applying pressure to the opponent.

This deck revolves around playing aggressively with a mix of different colors, utilizing cards that support each other's abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy involves using efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu to deal damage quickly, while also having access to powerful spells such as Lightning Bolt for removal. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide additional support to the aggressive creatures, ensuring a strong board presence. Stubborn Denial offers protection against removal spells, allowing the deck to maintain pressure and control the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards that can quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures, such as Generous Ent and Overlord of the Balemurk, to ultimately cast Living End and bring all those creatures back onto the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact to disrupt opponents' strategies and protect its own creatures. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a sudden surge of powerful creatures and control the battlefield.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant) to ramp up mana quickly and cast powerful colorless spells. It utilizes control elements such as Karn Liberated, All Is Dust, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to dominate the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny to apply pressure and control the battlefield. Overall, the key concept revolves around efficiently ramping up mana, controlling the board, and deploying powerful threats to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, while also controlling the board with cards like Leyline of the Guildpact and Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to apply pressure early on and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Stubborn Denial and Leyline Binding. Additionally, cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional win conditions and utility. The deck's mana base is flexible to support its aggressive and controlling elements.

The key concept of this deck is to assemble a powerful combo using cards like Fallaji Archaeologist, Hydroelectric Specimen, Whir of Invention, and Goblin Charbelcher without relying on traditional lands. Disruption and protection spells like Disrupting Shoal and Force of Negation help control the game while Suppression Ray and Tameshi, Reality Architect provide utility. The deck aims to quickly ramp up and overwhelm the opponent with a devastating combo, while also utilizing counter spells like Spell Snare and Jwari Disruption to protect its key pieces.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Solitude. The win condition is typically through powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury or Wrath of the Skies. The deck also includes a mix of utility lands and can play a longer game with cards like Lórien Revealed and Ephemerate. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a grindy game.

The deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures and ramp spells to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures. By utilizing cards like Ugin's Labyrinth to disrupt the opponent's strategy and Malevolent Rumble to clear the board, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence with cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Additionally, the deck includes artifacts like Karn, the Great Creator to provide additional utility and disruption. The goal is to control the game until the Eldrazi creatures can take over and secure victory.
